page.title: 15Violin Maker
page.content: Some of our class went to visit an elderly man called Mr. Perry who is a violin maker.We were a small group of six and Mr. Perry seemed very pleased. He told us that he used maple wood for the back and sides of the violin and spruce for the front.He made the bow out of horses hairs.It takes 600_700 hours to make a complete violin.The back of a violin costs Â£105.00 and the neck costs Â£90.00.When he makes a violin he charges Â£1000.00 but really he should charge around Â£4000.00. He makes different sizes of violins,they are a quarter,half and full size.He also makes the viola, 'cello, and double bass.Apart from musical instruments Mr. Perry makes a variety of wooden articles including plates,bowls,solitare and cribbage boards.I think he is an excellent craftsman.
